definition: asset that gives a competitive advantage/a strength/(market) niche
Maliki or Al-Maliki (name)/Nouri Kamel al-Maliki (1950-) prime minister of Iraq from 2006
Palikir, capital of the Federated States of Micronesia

sentences.english: Mr Maliki is wooing smaller Shia parties.
sentences.chinese: 马利基一直在争取小型什叶党派的支持。

sentences.english: I wish to use the site for another niche and as such, i need the theme redone.
sentences.chinese: 我想用另一利基网站，因此，我需要重做的主题。

sentences.english: Is that a niche that will finally take off this year?
sentences.chinese: 这会不会是一个在今年完成腾飞的利基市场？

sentences.english: Partial counts have Mr. al-Maliki leading in two predominantly Shiite provinces. But Mr.
sentences.chinese: 部分计票显示，马利基在两个什叶派主导的省份领先。

sentences.english: President Bush meets with Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki following his General Assembly speech.
sentences.chinese: 总统布什在他的大会讲话后会见了伊拉克总统马利基。

sentences.english: Another basic problem is the domestic political weakness of Mr Maliki.
sentences.chinese: 另一基本问题即马利基的内政弱点。

sentences.english: Look for holes in the market that will help you define your niche.
sentences.chinese: 寻找市场突破口，这将有助于你定位你的利基群体。

sentences.english: Mr. Maliki stressed that the government will never stop battling outlaws, criminals and militants.
sentences.chinese: 马利基强调，政府不会停止向罪犯及激进分子作斗争。

sentences.english: Germanys family owned small and middle sized enterprises will have to be niche players.
sentences.chinese: 德国家族式中小型企业将会成为利基型企业。

sentences.english: Alot of them are in niche markets, where the barriers to entry are high and the market very small.
sentences.chinese: 有不少是利基市场的行业，门槛高，市场窄。

sentences.english: It was an achievement that Maliki was able to get it through the government.
sentences.chinese: 能够在政府内阁中推动这项协议是马利基取得的成就。

sentences.english: Maliki tried to block the second shoe with his arm.
sentences.chinese: 马利基曾试图用手臂阻挡第二只鞋子。

sentences.english: Most successful marketing tales begin and end with a well-plumbed niche.
sentences.chinese: 许多成功的营销佳话都源自定位精良的利基。

sentences.english: Talabani and Maliki were unwilling to travel to the US base on the outskirts of the capital.
sentences.chinese: 塔拉巴尼和马利基并不愿意进入首都外围的美军基地。

sentences.english: Our stone chopping tool was one of the ones that Leakey found.
sentences.chinese: 我们这块石制砍砸器正是当初利基发掘成果之一。

sentences.english: The bounty of the World Wide Web encourages niche interests.
sentences.chinese: 万维网的慷慨支持了利基利益。

definition: dealer/trader/person engaged in some industry or trade
